summary: This is a JPMorgan Chase asset account portfolio statement for October 1999 for the entity 'FINANCIAL TRUST COMPANY, INC.', showing holdings in a money market fund. A key transaction shows a wire transfer of $18.3 million to Bear Stearns for the benefit of Ghislaine Maxwell.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: Named as the beneficiary (FAO - For the Account Of) of an $18.3 million wire transfer from the Financial Trust Company, Inc. account to Bear Stearns.

persons.name: Scott/Dencker
persons.context: Listed as the service specialist for the account on the document's table of contents page.

connections.description: The Financial Trust Company, Inc. account sent an $18.3 million wire transfer to Bear Stearns for the benefit of Ghislaine Maxwell.

events.title: Wire transfer to Ghislaine Maxwell
events.description: An $18.3 million wire transfer was sent from the Financial Trust Company, Inc. account at JPMorgan to Bear Stearns, for the account of Ghislaine Maxwell.

events.title: Account funding and purchase
events.description: $20 million was transferred into the account and used to purchase shares in the J.P. Morgan Institutional Prime Money Market Fund.

events.title: Additional purchase
events.description: An additional $5 million was transferred into the account and used to purchase more shares in the same money market fund.

locations: 345 Park Avenue, New York, NY 10154-1002 (Morgan Guaranty Trust Company/JPMorgan address)
6100 Red Hook, Quarters #2, St Thomas, US Virgin Islands 00802 (Financial Trust Company, Inc. mailing address at American Yacht Harbor)
keyFacts: On October 19, 1999, an $18.3 million wire transfer was sent from a JPMorgan account held by 'FINANCIAL TRUST COMPANY, INC.' to Bear Stearns, explicitly 'FAO GHISLAINE MAXWELL' (For the Account Of).
The Financial Trust Company, Inc. was based at the American Yacht Harbor in St. Thomas, US Virgin Islands, a location associated with Epstein's activities.
The account held over $6.7 million in a J.P. Morgan Institutional Prime Money Market Fund as of October 31, 1999.
The document is a standard financial portfolio statement, indicating the scale and professional management of funds connected to entities in the Epstein network.
